byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: Maternity and neonatal ward in Saudi Arabian hospital is consumed by fire which kills 25 people and wounds over 100; Saudi officials attribute latest in series of recent disasters to breakdown in facility's safety protocols; government is increasingly under pressure to address preventable calamities.
lead_paragraph: The authorities were investigating the cause of the blaze in Jizan, which also injured more than 100, in the third mass calamity to hit the desert kingdom in the past four months.

headline.main: Fire in Saudi Hospital’s Maternity Unit Kills at Least 25
headline.print_headline: Fire in Saudi Hospital Maternity Unit Kills at Least 25

snippet: The authorities were investigating the cause of the blaze in Jizan, which also injured more than 100, in the third mass calamity to hit the desert kingdom in the past four months.
